page.title: 12Religion (cont)
page.content: We did a survey which shows that less than 3% of the population of Dinnington and its immediate area took part in any form of worship. Of these there was a slight majority who attended the{Church of England.}We also found that there was a place where{Pentecostalists}met to pray. There were also individual{Jehovah's {Witnesses}but this did not alter our finding that Dinnington is not really a religious place. A lot of{weddings}take place (about 150 a year) and a high number of {funerals}(about 300 a year in a population of under 8000) which shows that Dinnington has a high percentage of old people. There is a strong youth club in the{Methodist Church}as well as a Tuesday Bible group. There is also a strong{Salvation Army}group but no Citadel.
